radiographic_examinations.findings: Thickened NT of 3.4 mm, absence of nasal bones, and poor ossifications in the cranium and vertebrae.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: At 21 weeks 4 days, mild improvement in cranium ossification with hypo-mineralization, persistent lack of nasal bones, poorly ossified vertebrae, femur and humerus lengths below the tenth percentile, and bowing of the tibia and fibula.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild improvement in cranium ossification with hypo-mineralization, persistent lack of nasal bones, poorly ossified vertebrae, femur and humerus lengths below the tenth percentile, and bowing of the tibia and fibula.
